data.name: Graph Theory: Detect an arborescence
data.description:
Write a function that, given a rooted, directed graph, returns true if the graph is an [arborescence](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arborescence_%28graph_theory%29) or false otherwise.

A graph is an arborescence if there is exactly one directed path from the root node to every other node. In other words, the graph forms a directed spanning tree.

---

A simple graph node data structure is provided which contains a collection, `Connections`, of all of the nodes that are linked to it. Each node is itself a subgraph.

In C#, it looks like this:

```csharp
interface IGraph
{
  IEnumerable<IGraph> Connections { get; }
}```

# Background Reading

* A [graph](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_%28mathematics%29) is a set of nodes in which pairs of nodes are connected to each other via a link.
* A [directed graph](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directed_graph) is a graph in which the links can only be followed in one direction.
* A [tree](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tree_%28graph_theory%29) is a connected graph without any cycles.
* A [spanning tree](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spanning_tree) is a tree that includes all of the nodes in a graph.
